cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to the Alluxio instance.

mem.description: Memory to allocate to the Alluxio instance.

disk.description: Disk (MB) to allocate to the Alluxio instance.

cmd.description: A shell command for your container to execute.

back_off_seconds.description: The amount of time (in seconds) before Marathon retries launching a failed task.

back_off_factor.description: The multiplicand to apply to the backoffSeconds value.

max_launch_delay_seconds.description: The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait, after applying the backoffSeconds and backoffFactor values, before attempting to restart failed tasks.

placement.description: Constraints control where apps run to allow optimizing for either fault tolerance (by spreading a task out on multiple nodes) or locality (by running all of an applications tasks on the same node).

constraints.description: Constraints have three parts: a field name, an operator, and an optional parameter. The field can be the hostname of the agent node or any attribute of the agent node. Example: [["rack_id", "LIKE", "rack-foo-.*"], ["rack_id", "MAX_PER", "2"]]

region.description: All application nodes will run in this region. When no region is specified the nodes are constrained to the local region.

networking.description: Configure the networking for your service.

volumes.description: Create a stateful service by configuring a persistent volume. Persistent volumes enable instances to be restarted without data loss.

tier0_host_volume.description: A host volume is a directory on the local agent mapped to one in a container.

host_path.description: The host path of the storage directory for the top storage tier

container_path.description: The path of storage directory for the top storage tier

tier1_host_volume.description: A host volume is a directory on the local agent mapped to one in a container.

enable_tier1.description: Indicate whether a second storage tier is used

host_path.description: The host path of the storage directory for the second storage tier

container_path.description: The path of storage directory for the second storage tier

tier2_host_volume.description: A host volume is a directory on the local agent mapped to one in a container.

enable_tier2.description: Indicate whether a third storage tier is used

host_path.description: The host path of the storage directory for the third storage tier

container_path.description: The path of storage directory for the third storage tier

health_checks.description: Health checks may be specified per application to be run against the application's instances.

port_index.description: Specifies the port index in the ports array that is used for health requests.

grace_periods.description: Health check failures are ignored within this number of seconds or until the instance becomes healthy for the first time.

intervals.description: Number of seconds to wait between health checks.

timeout.description: Number of seconds after which a health check is considered a failure regardless of the response.

max_failures.description: Number of consecutive health check failures after which the unhealthy instance should be killed. HTTP & TCP health checks: If this value is 0, instances will not be killed if they fail the health check.

tier_levels.description: The number of storage tiers on the worker

tier0_watermark_high_ratio.description: The high watermark of the space in the top storage tier (a value between 0 and 1)

tier0_watermark_low_ratio.description: The low watermark of the space in the top storage tier (a value between 0 and 1)

tier1_watermark_high_ratio.description: The high watermark of the space in the second storage tier (a value between 0 and 1)

tier1_watermark_low_ratio.description: The low watermark of the space in the second storage tier (a value between 0 and 1)

tier2_watermark_high_ratio.description: The high watermark of the space in the third storage tier (a value between 0 and 1)

tier2_watermark_low_ratio.description: The low watermark of the space in the third storage tier (a value between 0 and 1)
